message.content:
A baseball is a small spherical ball used in a game of baseball. 
It typically measures three inches in diameter and weighs around five ounces. 
The ball is made of leather or faux leather, tightly stitched with a raised seam around the circumference. 
The color of a baseball is white with red stitching, although variations in color are occasionally used for practice and training. 
The surface of a baseball is smooth to the touch and has a glossy appearance. 
Baseballs are used primarily in the game of baseball and can be found in sports stores, stadiums, and fields. 
Their distinct characteristics make them easy to identify and differentiate from other balls used in similar sports.
